notes

  • Insert 16 for 14-oct-2025, which makes
    • Rename 16 -> 17,
    • Rename 17 -> 18,
    • Rename 18 -> 19.
  • Related presentation might be
    • bna78 046 computation, simulation, visualization, animation: comparison and stages.
    • gfq9y 100 Short intro to model: Types, illustrations, examples.
    • 9ukby 053 Visualization with coxcomb chart: Florence Nightingaleâs rose diagram.
    • q2n58 023 Scientific visualization: A brief history.
    • 6vyau 109 Unlimited visualization ideas: Some examples.
    • p95tw 066 Visualization in science: A Reflection before midterm of a course in 24-1.
    • 3rb8k 019 Source of dataType, limitation, validation, etc.
    • p4ykz 027 Multidimensional visualization: Static and dynamic approaches.
  • Some refs in a presentation
    • Ehwan Kurniawan, “Indonesian Animation Industry Ecosystem Study”, Universitas Pakuan, Bogor, p 150, url https://repository.unpak.ac.id/tukangna/repo/file/files-20200807172957.pdf#page=150 [20250901].
    • K. Eberhard, “The effects of visualization on judgment and decision-making: a systematic literature review”, Management Review Quarterly, vol 73, p 167â214, Feb 2023, url https://doi.org/10.1007/s11301-021-00235-8 .
    • S. M. Manson, “Simulation”, in International Encyclopedia of Human Geography, 2009, p 132-137, url https://doi.org/10.1016/B978-008044910-4.00516-2 .
    • Matthias Scheutz, “Computation, Philosophical Issues about”, in Encyclopedia of Cognitive Science, Jan 2006, url http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/0470018860.s00209 .
